content.text:
# Draft:Edward Dudensing

----
Edward Dudensing is an American attorney based in California. He is the founder of Dudensing Law, a firm that focuses on elder abuse and neglect litigation.
Early life and education
Dudensing received his B.A. in Political Science from the University of California, Berkeley, and his J.D. from the University of California, Davis School of Law in 1994. He was inducted into the Order of the Coif and served as Executive Editor of the UC Davis Law Review.
Career
After law school, Dudensing clerked for Judge Robert C. Broomfield of the United States District Court for the District of Arizona. He later worked at Orrick, Herrington & Sutcliffe and served as a Deputy District Attorney in Sacramento County from 1999 to 2003.
In 2003, he founded Dudensing Law, representing plaintiffs in elder abuse and neglect cases.
Selected cases
* Rios v. Pine Creek Care Center – A jury awarded $30.9 million in 2023.
* Lovenstein v. Eskaton Fountainwood Lodge – A jury awarded $42.5 million in 2019.
* Estate of Frances Tanner v. Horizon West Healthcare – A jury awarded $29.1 million in 2010.
He has also served as lead counsel in appellate decisions, including:
* Valentine v. Plum Healthcare Group, 37 Cal. App. 5th 1076 (2019)
* Hutcheson v. Eskaton Fountainwood Lodge, 17 Cal. App. 5th 937 (2017)
* Goldman v. Sunbridge Healthcare, 220 Cal. App. 4th 1160 (2013)
Teaching
Dudensing is an adjunct professor at the University of California College of the Law, San Francisco.
References
